title: Industrials Down On Trade-Talks, Hard-Brexit Worries — Industrials Roundup
text:
Shares of industrial and transportation companies fell as the odds of a trade deal with China and a Brexit deal in Europe shrank.

The U.S. blacklisted 28 Chinese companies, including some which developed facial recognition and other forms of artificial-intelligence products, alleged to be linked to abuse of minorities in China. The U.S. also plans to restrict visas for Chinese officials linked to the abuse.

The new leaders of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank warned in twin speeches of a deteriorating global economic outlook, just a week before they will lead the annual meetings of their institutions for the first time. "The global economy is now in a synchronized slowdown," said Kristalina Georgieva of Bulgaria, the former No. 2 official at the World Bank, who took the helm of the IMF a week ago, as reported earlier.

Boeing booked its first 737 MAX order since April but also reported cancellations for 22 of its 787 Dreamliners, as the embattled aerospace giant struggles to get its order flow back on track after the grounding of the MAX jet.
